intro: Mirbelia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved mirbelia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are small, woody pods that split open to release seeds. Mirbelia longifolia is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
